metadata.title: Lines and Angles for Kids
metadata.description: Interactive questions to build understanding of basic geometry concepts
metadata.author: Math Educator

questions.question: What is a point in geometry?
questions.explanation: A point is an exact location with no size - we represent it with a dot.

questions.question: Match types of lines with end points
A straight line: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Goes on forever in both directions

questions.explanation: Lines continue infinitely in both directions.

questions.question: An angle is formed by:

options.text: Two lines intersection at a point

questions.explanation: An angle is made when two lines or rays meet at a common point called the vertex.

questions.question: An angle measuring 45° is an ____ angle.
Which angle is reflex?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><path d='M50,100 L100,100 A50,50 0 1,1 100,150 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M150,100 L200,100 A50,50 0 0,1 200,50 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The left angle is the larger portion (more than 180°), making it reflex.

questions.question: An angle bisector:

options.text: divides the angle into 3 equal parts
divides the angle into 2 equal parts

questions.explanation: A bisector divides an angle into two equal smaller angles.
